com.sendev.databasemanager.utils

Class Collection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sendev.databasemanager.utils.Collection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<DataRow>

    public class Collection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<DataRow>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Collection(java.sql.ResultSet result)
      Creates a new Collection instance, allowing you to the loop and fetch data from a ResultSet object a lot easier.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.util.List<DataRow> all()
      Gets all the DataRow items from the collection.

      Gets the first index of the collection.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> get(java.lang.String name)
      Gets every column with the given index, if the index doesn't exists a DatabaseException will be thrown.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getKeys()
      Gets all the keys from the ResultSet object in the form of a HashMap, where the key is the database table column name, and the value is the database column type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collection

        public Collection(java.sql.ResultSet result)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new Collection instance, allowing you to the loop and fetch data from a ResultSet object a lot easier.
        Parameters:
        result - The ResultSet to generate the collection from.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs, this exception is thrown if the collection was unable to read form the database ResultSet object, or if the object didn't return a valid response.

    • Method Detail

      • first

        public DataRow first()
        Gets the first index of the collection.
        Returns:
        either (1) The first DataRow object, generated from the ResultSet object, or (2) NULL if the collection doesn't have any items.

      • all

        public java.util.List<DataRow> all()
        Gets all the DataRow items from the collection.
        Returns:
        All the DataRow items from the collection.

      • get

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> get(java.lang.String name)
        Gets every column with the given index, if the index doesn't exists a DatabaseException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - The index(name) to lookup.
        Returns:
        either (1) A list of objects with the given index, or (2) NULL if the given index doesn't exists.

      • getStrings

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStrings(java.lang.String name)
        Gets every column with the given index, if the index doesn't exists a DatabaseException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - The index(name) to lookup.
        Returns:
        A list of strings with the given index.

      • getKeys

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getKeys()
        Gets all the keys from the ResultSet object in the form of a HashMap, where the key is the database table column name, and the value is the database column type.
        Returns:
        A map of all the database keys.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<DataRow> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<DataRow>
